trans-unit.source: Move data to and from Azure Table | Azure Data Factory
trans-unit.target: Move data to and from Azure Table | Azure Data Factory

trans-unit.source: Learn how to move data to/from Azure Table Storage using Azure Data Factory.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to move data to/from Azure Table Storage using Azure Data Factory.

trans-unit.source: Move data to and from Azure Table using Azure Data Factory
trans-unit.target: Move data to and from Azure Table using Azure Data Factory

trans-unit.source: This article outlines how you can use the Copy Activity in an Azure data factory to move data to Azure Table from another data store and move data from another data store to Azure Table.
trans-unit.target: This article outlines how you can use the Copy Activity in an Azure data factory to move data to Azure Table from another data store and move data from another data store to Azure Table.

trans-unit.source: This article builds on the [data movement activities](data-factory-data-movement-activities.md) article which presents a general overview of data movement with copy activity and supported data store combinations.
trans-unit.target: This article builds on the [data movement activities](data-factory-data-movement-activities.md) article which presents a general overview of data movement with copy activity and supported data store combinations.

trans-unit.source: Sample: Copy data from Azure Table to Azure Blob
trans-unit.target: Sample: Copy data from Azure Table to Azure Blob

trans-unit.source: A linked service of type [AzureStorage](data-factory-azure-blob-connector.md#azure-storage-linked-service-properties) (used for both table & blob).
trans-unit.target: A linked service of type [AzureStorage](data-factory-azure-blob-connector.md#azure-storage-linked-service-properties) (used for both table & blob).

trans-unit.source: The [pipeline](data-factory-create-pipelines.md) with Copy activity that uses [AzureTableSource](#azure-table-copy-activity-type-properties) and [BlobSink](data-factory-azure-blob-connector.md#azure-blob-copy-activity-type-properties).
trans-unit.target: The [pipeline](data-factory-create-pipelines.md) with Copy activity that uses [AzureTableSource](#azure-table-copy-activity-type-properties) and [BlobSink](data-factory-azure-blob-connector.md#azure-blob-copy-activity-type-properties).

trans-unit.source: The sample copies data belonging to the default partition in an Azure Table to a blob every hour.
trans-unit.target: The sample copies data belonging to the default partition in an Azure Table to a blob every hour.

trans-unit.source: The JSON properties used in these samples are described in sections following the samples.
trans-unit.target: The JSON properties used in these samples are described in sections following the samples.

trans-unit.source: The sample assumes you have created a table “MyTable” in Azure Table.
trans-unit.target: The sample assumes you have created a table “MyTable” in Azure Table.

trans-unit.source: Setting “external”: ”true” and specifying externalData policy tells data factory that this is a table that is external to the data factory and not produced by an activity in the data factory.
trans-unit.target: Setting “external”: ”true” and specifying externalData policy tells data factory that this is a table that is external to the data factory and not produced by an activity in the data factory.

trans-unit.source: Data is written to a new blob every hour (frequency: hour, interval: 1).
trans-unit.target: Data is written to a new blob every hour (frequency: hour, interval: 1).

trans-unit.source: The folder path for the blob is dynamically evaluated based on the start time of the slice that is being processed.
trans-unit.target: The folder path for the blob is dynamically evaluated based on the start time of the slice that is being processed.

trans-unit.source: The folder path uses year, month, day, and hours parts of the start time.
trans-unit.target: The folder path uses year, month, day, and hours parts of the start time.

trans-unit.source: The pipeline contains a Copy Activity that is configured to use the above input and output datasets and is scheduled to run every hour.
trans-unit.target: The pipeline contains a Copy Activity that is configured to use the above input and output datasets and is scheduled to run every hour.

trans-unit.source: In the pipeline JSON definition, the **source** type is set to **AzureTableSource** and **sink** type is set to **BlobSink**.
trans-unit.target: In the pipeline JSON definition, the **source** type is set to **AzureTableSource** and **sink** type is set to **BlobSink**.

trans-unit.source: The SQL query specified with **AzureTableSourceQuery** property selects the data from the default partition every hour to copy.
trans-unit.target: The SQL query specified with **AzureTableSourceQuery** property selects the data from the default partition every hour to copy.

trans-unit.source: Sample: Copy data from Azure Blob to Azure Table
trans-unit.target: Sample: Copy data from Azure Blob to Azure Table

trans-unit.source: A linked service of type [AzureStorage](data-factory-azure-blob-connector.md#azure-storage-linked-service-properties) (used for both table & blob)
trans-unit.target: A linked service of type [AzureStorage](data-factory-azure-blob-connector.md#azure-storage-linked-service-properties) (used for both table & blob)

trans-unit.source: The [pipeline](data-factory-create-pipelines.md) with Copy activity that uses [BlobSource](data-factory-azure-blob-connector.md#azure-blob-copy-activity-type-properties) and [AzureTableSink](#azure-table-copy-activity-type-properties).
trans-unit.target: The [pipeline](data-factory-create-pipelines.md) with Copy activity that uses [BlobSource](data-factory-azure-blob-connector.md#azure-blob-copy-activity-type-properties) and [AzureTableSink](#azure-table-copy-activity-type-properties).

trans-unit.source: The sample copies data belonging to a time series from Azure blob to a table in Azure Table database every hour.
trans-unit.target: The sample copies data belonging to a time series from Azure blob to a table in Azure Table database every hour.

trans-unit.source: The JSON properties used in these samples are described in sections following the samples.
trans-unit.target: The JSON properties used in these samples are described in sections following the samples.

trans-unit.source: Azure storage (for both Azure Table & Blob) linked service:
trans-unit.target: Azure storage (for both Azure Table & Blob) linked service:

trans-unit.source: Data is picked up from a new blob every hour (frequency: hour, interval: 1).
trans-unit.target: Data is picked up from a new blob every hour (frequency: hour, interval: 1).

trans-unit.source: The folder path and file name for the blob are dynamically evaluated based on the start time of the slice that is being processed.
trans-unit.target: The folder path and file name for the blob are dynamically evaluated based on the start time of the slice that is being processed.

trans-unit.source: The folder path uses year, month, and day part of the start time and file name uses the hour part of the start time.
trans-unit.target: The folder path uses year, month, and day part of the start time and file name uses the hour part of the start time.

trans-unit.source: “external”: “true” setting informs the Data Factory service that this table is external to the data factory and not produced by an activity in the data factory.
trans-unit.target: “external”: “true” setting informs the Data Factory service that this table is external to the data factory and not produced by an activity in the data factory.

trans-unit.source: The sample copies data to a table named “MyTable” in Azure Table.
trans-unit.target: The sample copies data to a table named “MyTable” in Azure Table.

trans-unit.source: You should create the table in Azure Table with the same number of columns as you expect the Blob CSV file to contain.
trans-unit.target: You should create the table in Azure Table with the same number of columns as you expect the Blob CSV file to contain.

trans-unit.source: New rows are added to the table every hour.
trans-unit.target: New rows are added to the table every hour.

trans-unit.source: The pipeline contains a Copy Activity that is configured to use the above input and output datasets and is scheduled to run every hour.
trans-unit.target: The pipeline contains a Copy Activity that is configured to use the above input and output datasets and is scheduled to run every hour.

trans-unit.source: In the pipeline JSON definition, the **source** type is set to **BlobSource** and **sink** type is set to **AzureTableSink**.
trans-unit.target: In the pipeline JSON definition, the **source** type is set to **BlobSource** and **sink** type is set to **AzureTableSink**.

trans-unit.source: You can link an Azure storage account to an Azure data factory with Azure Storage linked service.
trans-unit.target: You can link an Azure storage account to an Azure data factory with Azure Storage linked service.

trans-unit.source: The following table provides descriptions for JSON elements specific to Azure Storage linked service.
trans-unit.target: The following table provides descriptions for JSON elements specific to Azure Storage linked service.

trans-unit.source: The type property must be set to: AzureStorage
trans-unit.target: The type property must be set to: AzureStorage

trans-unit.source: Specify information needed to connect to Azure storage for the connectionString property.
trans-unit.target: Specify information needed to connect to Azure storage for the connectionString property.

trans-unit.source: You can get the connectionString for the Azure storage from the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can get the connectionString for the Azure storage from the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: For a full list of sections & properties available for defining datasets, see the [Creating datasets](data-factory-create-datasets.md) article.
trans-unit.target: For a full list of sections & properties available for defining datasets, see the [Creating datasets](data-factory-create-datasets.md) article.

trans-unit.source: Sections like structure, availability, and policy of a dataset JSON are similar for all dataset types (Azure SQL, Azure blob, Azure table, etc...).
trans-unit.target: Sections like structure, availability, and policy of a dataset JSON are similar for all dataset types (Azure SQL, Azure blob, Azure table, etc...).

trans-unit.source: The typeProperties section is different for each type of dataset and provides information about the location of the data in the data store.
trans-unit.target: The typeProperties section is different for each type of dataset and provides information about the location of the data in the data store.

trans-unit.source: The **typeProperties** section for the dataset of type **AzureTable** has the following properties.
trans-unit.target: The **typeProperties** section for the dataset of type **AzureTable** has the following properties.

trans-unit.source: Name of the table in the Azure Table Database instance that linked service refers to.
trans-unit.target: Name of the table in the Azure Table Database instance that linked service refers to.

trans-unit.source: Azure Table Copy Activity type properties
trans-unit.target: Azure Table Copy Activity type properties

trans-unit.source: For a full list of sections & properties available for defining activities, see the [Creating Pipelines](data-factory-create-pipelines.md) article.
trans-unit.target: For a full list of sections & properties available for defining activities, see the [Creating Pipelines](data-factory-create-pipelines.md) article.

trans-unit.source: Properties like name, description, input and output tables, various policies etc are available for all types of activities.
trans-unit.target: Properties like name, description, input and output tables, various policies etc are available for all types of activities.

trans-unit.source: Properties available in the typeProperties section of the activity on the other hand vary with each activity type and in case of Copy activity they vary depending on the types of sources and sinks.
trans-unit.target: Properties available in the typeProperties section of the activity on the other hand vary with each activity type and in case of Copy activity they vary depending on the types of sources and sinks.

trans-unit.source: **AzureTableSource** supports the following properties in typeProperties section:
trans-unit.target: **AzureTableSource** supports the following properties in typeProperties section:

trans-unit.source: Use the custom query to read data.
trans-unit.target: Use the custom query to read data.

trans-unit.source: Indicate whether swallow the exception of table not exist.
trans-unit.target: Indicate whether swallow the exception of table not exist.

trans-unit.source: **AzureTableSink** supports the following properties in typeProperties section:
trans-unit.target: **AzureTableSink** supports the following properties in typeProperties section:

trans-unit.source: Default partition key value that can be used by the sink.
trans-unit.target: Default partition key value that can be used by the sink.

trans-unit.source: User specified column name, whose column values are used as partition key.
trans-unit.target: User specified column name, whose column values are used as partition key.

trans-unit.source: If not specified, AzureTableDefaultPartitionKeyValue is used as the partition key.
trans-unit.target: If not specified, AzureTableDefaultPartitionKeyValue is used as the partition key.

trans-unit.source: User specified column name, whose column values are used as row key.
trans-unit.target: User specified column name, whose column values are used as row key.

trans-unit.source: If not specified, use a GUID for each row.
trans-unit.target: If not specified, use a GUID for each row.

trans-unit.source: The mode to insert data into Azure table.
trans-unit.target: The mode to insert data into Azure table.

trans-unit.source: Inserts data into the Azure table when the writeBatchSize or writeBatchTimeout is hit.
trans-unit.target: Inserts data into the Azure table when the writeBatchSize or writeBatchTimeout is hit.

trans-unit.source: Inserts data into the Azure table when the writeBatchSize or writeBatchTimeout is hit
trans-unit.target: Inserts data into the Azure table when the writeBatchSize or writeBatchTimeout is hit

trans-unit.source: No (Default to storage client default timeout value 90 sec)
trans-unit.target: No (Default to storage client default timeout value 90 sec)

trans-unit.source: As mentioned in the [data movement activities](data-factory-data-movement-activities.md) article, Copy activity performs automatic type conversions from automatic type conversions from source types to sink types with the following 2 step approach.
trans-unit.target: As mentioned in the [data movement activities](data-factory-data-movement-activities.md) article, Copy activity performs automatic type conversions from automatic type conversions from source types to sink types with the following 2 step approach.

trans-unit.source: Convert from native source types to .NET type
trans-unit.target: Convert from native source types to .NET type

trans-unit.source: Convert from .NET type to native sink type
trans-unit.target: Convert from .NET type to native sink type

trans-unit.source: When moving data to & from Azure Table, the following [mappings defined by Azure Table service](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dd179338.aspx) will be used from Azure Table OData types to .NET type and vice versa.
trans-unit.target: When moving data to & from Azure Table, the following [mappings defined by Azure Table service](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dd179338.aspx) will be used from Azure Table OData types to .NET type and vice versa.

trans-unit.source: An array of bytes up to 64 KB in size.
trans-unit.target: An array of bytes up to 64 KB in size.

trans-unit.source: A 64-bit value expressed as Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
trans-unit.target: A 64-bit value expressed as Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

trans-unit.source: The supported DateTime range begins from 12:00 midnight, January 1, 1601 A.D.
trans-unit.target: The supported DateTime range begins from 12:00 midnight, January 1, 1601 A.D.

trans-unit.source: String values may be up to 64 KB in size.
trans-unit.target: String values may be up to 64 KB in size.

trans-unit.source: The following sample is for copying data from an Azure Blob to Azure Table with type conversions.
trans-unit.target: The following sample is for copying data from an Azure Blob to Azure Table with type conversions.

trans-unit.source: Suppose the Blob dataset is in CSV format and contains 3 columns.
trans-unit.target: Suppose the Blob dataset is in CSV format and contains 3 columns.

trans-unit.source: One of them is a datetime column with a custom datetime format using abbreviated French names for day of the week.
trans-unit.target: One of them is a datetime column with a custom datetime format using abbreviated French names for day of the week.

trans-unit.source: You will define the Blob Source dataset as follows along with type definitions for the columns.
trans-unit.target: You will define the Blob Source dataset as follows along with type definitions for the columns.

trans-unit.source: Given the type mapping from Azure Table OData type to .NET type above you would define the table in Azure Table with the following schema.
trans-unit.target: Given the type mapping from Azure Table OData type to .NET type above you would define the table in Azure Table with the following schema.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will define the Azure Table dataset as follows.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will define the Azure Table dataset as follows.

trans-unit.source: You do not need to specify “structure” section with the type information since the type information is already specified in the underlying data store.
trans-unit.target: You do not need to specify “structure” section with the type information since the type information is already specified in the underlying data store.

trans-unit.source: In this case data factory will automatically do the type conversions including the Datetime field with the custom datetime format using the fr-fr culture when moving data from Blob to Azure Table.
trans-unit.target: In this case data factory will automatically do the type conversions including the Datetime field with the custom datetime format using the fr-fr culture when moving data from Blob to Azure Table.
